newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Applied Materials is up.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Applied Materials is up.

text.p: Applied Materials Inc was up more than two points in after-hours trading on Tuesday after releasing quarterly earnings just after the bell that apparently impressed some traders.

Applied was trading at 47-1/2, after closing at 45-1/8. It reported Q1 January 26 earnings of $0.16 per share, down from $0.93 for the same period the year before. The 1997 results included a $0.32-per-share charge from two acquisitions.
Otherwise, after-hours trading was mixed, traders said.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one volume was 282,090, compared to Monday's 12,400. Session two volume was 2,200,200, while on Monday it was 1,974,081.
The American Stock Exchange reported after-hours volume of 100 shares.
